articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS admits it is a “privilege” to work with Callum McGregor, the player he rates as the “heartbeat of this team”. The returning Celtic manager welcomed the news the captain had signed a new five-year deal which will keep him at the champions until he is 35. McGregor has been pivotal in the Hoops’ [...]
articles.title: ‘PRIVILEGE,’ RODGERS HAILS ‘HEARTBEAT OF THIS TEAM’

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CALLUM McGREGOR admitted he was “absolutely delighted” to sign a new five-year deal with Celtic. And then the 30-year-old captain declared: “There’s only one place that I want to play football and that’s here.” McGregor, who replaced the legendary Scott Brown as the team’s onfield leader at the start of the remarkable 2021/22 campaign, said: [...]
articles.title: ‘HUGELY PROUD,’ ADMITS McGREGOR AS HE COMMITS TO CELTIC

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Whatever doubts existed about the first team squad, we all knew there was no chance of Callum McGregor leaving.  This morning, Celtic announced the captain has signed a five-year contract which will keep him at the club until he turns 35.  It is likely to be his last in the game and will be structured [...]
articles.title: Callum McGregor, Celtic’s fittest ever player

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: ONE-TIME Celtic wonder Bhoy Dylan McGeouch has signed for English third-tier side Carlisle United. The midfielder was tipped for a massive future by Neil Lennon when he made his Hoops home debut as an 18-year-old prospect on November 26 2011. McGeouch came on for James Forrest in a league match against St Mirren at Parkhead [...]
articles.title: ONE-TIME WONDERBHOY IS THIRD RATE

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: FILIPE JOTA has sent a heartfelt message to Celtic fans following his rapid £25million exit for Saudi Arabian club Al-Ettihad. The fans’ favourite bowed out with the third goal in the Hoops’ 3-1 Scottish Cup Final triumph over Inverness Caley Thistle at Hampden on June 3. Jota was pivotal to the team’s success as they [...]
articles.title: ‘I LOVE YOU FOR LIFE,’ JOTA’S HEARTFELT MESSAGE TO CELTIC FANS

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CAMERON CARTER-VICKERS is ahead of schedule as he prepares to make his return. The USA World Cup centre-back missed the last six games of the season – including the treble-sealing Scottish Cup Final triumph – after undergoing knee surgery. Carter-Vickers, the rock in the Hoops rearguard, bowed out of the action after a Man-of-the-Match performance [...]
articles.title: RETURN OF THE ROCK

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: POLISH striker Pawel Brozek was brought to Celtic on loan from Turkish outfit Trabzonspor in January 2012. He returned to his parent club four months later after firing blanks in only three appearances for the Hoops. Brozek made just one start for the club in a league encounter against Motherwell at Fir Park on April [...]
articles.title: WHATEVER HAPPENED TO…PAWEL BROZEK?

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC legend Davie Hay continues his inside stories as he details the changes in Wim Jansen’s team as the new-look Hoops prepared to derail Rangers’ bid for 10 successive titles in the 1997/98 campaign. In another CQN EXCLUSIVE, the former player and manager opens up in a massive year of change at the club as he [...]
articles.title: CELTIC CONFIDENTIAL:  X-FACTOR BRATTBAKK, DAVIE HAY REVEALS ALL

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: EXACTLY thirty-four years ago today, Mo Johnston turned his back on Celtic, the club he professed to love, to join Rangers. Author Alex Gordon, who has written fifteen Celtic books including ‘50 Flags Plus One‘, a tribute to the club’s first 51 untainted titles, devoted a chapter in his first newspaper memoirs, ‘Jinx Dogs Burns [...]

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS insists evergreen winger James Forrest still has a crucial role to play for Celtic. The Scotland international, who celebrated his 32nd birthday during the week as CQN reported, was hindered by persistent injury during Ange Postecoglou’s debut campaign. And Forrest was used sparingly last term as fitness problems curtailed his outings in the [...]
articles.title: RODGERS REVEALS CELT WHO WILL HAVE ‘REALLY GOOD IMPACT’

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: LEGENDARY Celtic keeper Pat Bonner reckons Joe Hart faces a make-or-break period in the early stages of Brendan Rodgers’ return. The 36-year-old former England No.1 is entering the final 12 months of his Hoops contract after joining the champions in a cut-price £1million switch from Spurs in August 2021. Ironically, Ange Postecoglou, the manager who [...]
articles.title: JOE HART: BONNER POSES ‘THE BIG QUESTION’

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC’S £7million misfits Albian Ajeti and Ismaila Soro have been dealt stebacks as they head for the Hoops exit. The flop frontman, who cost £5million from West Ham in August 2020, and the midfielder, a £2million arrival from Israeli outfit Bnei Yehuda seven months earlier, have both returned to the champions after season-long loans. Ajeti, [...]
